          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=A+Concise+History+of+Greece&amp;rft.pages=101&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2002-06-20&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-521-00479-4&amp;rft.aulast=Clogg&amp;rft.aufirst=Richard&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DH5pyUIY4THYC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey">
           <span style="display:none;">
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </li>
        <li id="cite_note-BoweringCrone2012-105">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-BoweringCrone2012_105-0">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation book">
           Gerhard Bowering; Patricia Crone; Wadad Kadi; Devin J. Stewart; Muhammad Qasim Zaman; Mahan Mirza (28 November 2012).
           <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=JHcZlo12SGoC&amp;pg=PA49" rel="nofollow">
            <i>
             The Princeton Encyclopedia of Islamic Political Thought
            </i>
           </a>
           . Princeton University Press. p. 49.
           <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">
            ISBN
           </a>
           <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4008-3855-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4008-3855-4">
            978-1-4008-3855-4
           </a>
           <span class="reference-accessdate">
            . Retrieved
            <span class="nowrap">
             14 August
            </span>
            2013
           </span>
           .
           <q>
            Following the revolution, Mustafa Kemal became an important figure in the military ranks of the Ottoman Committee of Union and Progress (CUP) as a protégé ... Although the sultanate had already been abolished in November 1922, the republic was founded in October 1923. ... ambitious reform programme aimed at the creation of a modern, secular state and the construction of a new identity for its citizens.
           </q>
          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Princeton+Encyclopedia+of+Islamic+Political+Thought&amp;rft.pages=49&amp;rft.pub=Princeton+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2012-11-28&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4008-3855-4&amp;rft.au=Gerhard+Bowering&amp;rft.au=Patricia+Crone&amp;rft.au=Wadad+Kadi&amp;rft.au=Devin+J.+Stewart&amp;rft.au=Muhammad+Qasim+Zaman&amp;rft.au=Mahan+Mirza&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DJHcZlo12SGoC%26pg%3DPA49&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey">
           <span style="display:none;">

          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-Truman_Doctrine_108-0">
            ^

         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation book">
           Huston, James A. (1988).
           <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=ID4E3Lm8TsgC&amp;pg=PA134" rel="nofollow">
            <i>

            </i>

          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Outposts+and+Allies%3A+U.S.+Army+Logistics+in+the+Cold+War%2C+1945%E2%80%931953&amp;rft.pages=134&amp;rft.pub=Susquehanna+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1988&amp;rft.isbn=0-941664-84-8&amp;rft.aulast=Huston&amp;rft.aufirst=James+A.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DID4E3Lm8TsgC%26pg%3DPA134&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey">

            </i>
           </sup>
          </a>
          <a href="#cite_ref-joppien_124-1">
           <sup>
            <i>
             <b>

          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=How+Turkey+Went+From+%27Zero+Problems%27+to+Zero+Friends&amp;rft.pub=Foreign+Policy&amp;rft.date=2013-08-22&amp;rft.au=Piotr+Zalewsky&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fforeignpolicy.com%2F2013%2F08%2F22%2Fhow-turkey-went-from-zero-problems-to-zero-friends%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey">

          </span>
         </span>
        </li>

        <li id="cite_note-251">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-251">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation web">
           Bartolomiej Kaminski; Francis Ng (1 May 2006).
           <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070614030216/http://www-wds.worldbank.org/external/default/WDSContentServer/WDSP/IB/2006/05/03/000016406_20060503112446/Rendered/PDF/wps3908.pdf" rel="nofollow">
            "Turkey's evolving trade integration into Pan-European markets"
           </a>
           <span style="font-size:85%;">
            (PDF)
           </span>
           . World Bank. p. 3. Archived from
           <a class="external text" href="http://www-wds.worldbank.org/external/default/WDSContentServer/WDSP/IB/2006/05/03/000016406_20060503112446/Rendered/PDF/wps3908.pdf" rel="nofollow">
            the original
           </a>
           <span style="font-size:85%;">
            (PDF)
           </span>
           on 14 June 2007
           <span class="reference-accessdate">
            . Retrieved
            <span class="nowrap">
             27 December
            </span>
            2006
           </span>
           .
          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Turkey%27s+evolving+trade+integration+into+Pan-European+markets&amp;rft.pages=3&amp;rft.pub=World+Bank&amp;rft.date=2006-05-01&amp;rft.au=Bartolomiej+Kaminski&amp;rft.au=Francis+Ng&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww-wds.worldbank.org%2Fexternal%2Fdefault%2FWDSContentServer%2FWDSP%2FIB%2F2006%2F05%2F03%2F000016406_20060503112446%2FRendered%2FPDF%2Fwps3908.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey">
           <span style="display:none;">

           <a class="external text" href="http://www.os.is/gogn/Introductory_Lectures_2009/Direct%20application%20of%20geothermal%20energy%202005.pdf" rel="nofollow">

        <li id="cite_note-INOGATE_website-314">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-INOGATE_website_314-0">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation web">
           <a class="external text" href="http://www.inogate.org" rel="nofollow">
            "INOGATE website"
           </a>
           . Inogate.org

        <li id="cite_note-330">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-330">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation book">
           Edgecomb, Diane; Ahmed, Mohammed M. A.; Özel, Çeto (2007).
           <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=7-0SAQAAIAAJ" rel="nofollow">
            <i>
             A fire in my heart: Kurdish tales
            </i>
           </a>
           . Westport CT: Libraries Unlimited. p. xv.
           <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">
            ISBN
           </a>
           <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/159158437X" title="Special:BookSources/159158437X">
            159158437X
           </a>
           .
           <q>
            The outlines of the map of Kurdistan were taken from two sources: first, a map produced by the CIA in 1992 depicting areas with a Kurdish majority [...]
           </q>
          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=A+fire+in+my+heart%3A+Kurdish+tales&amp;rft.place=Westport+CT&amp;rft.pages=xv&amp;rft.pub=Libraries+Unlimited&amp;rft.date=2007&amp;rft.isbn=159158437X&amp;rft.aulast=Edgecomb&amp;rft.aufirst=Diane&amp;rft.au=Ahmed%2C+Mohammed+M.+A.&amp;rft.au=%C3%96zel%2C+%C3%87eto&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D7-0SAQAAIAAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey">
           <span style="display:none;">

         <span class="reference-text">

          <cite class="citation web">

        <li id="cite_note-377">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-377">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <i>
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Catholic_Encyclopedia" title="The Catholic Encyclopedia">
            The Catholic Encyclopedia
           </a>
          </i>
          , Volume XIV, Copyright © 1912 by Robert Appleton Company, Online Edition Copyright © 2003 by K. Knight
          <a class="external autonumber" href="http://www.newadvent.org/cathen/14774a.htm" rel="nofollow">
           [1]
          </a>
         </span>
        </li>
        <li id="cite_note-378">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-378">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <i>
           Home of the Assumption: Reconstructing Mary's Life in Ephesus
          </i>
          by V. Antony John Alaharasan 2006
          <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">
           ISBN
          </a>
          <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/1-929039-38-7" title="Special:BookSources/1-929039-38-7">
           1-929039-38-7
          </a>
          page 38
         </span>
        </li>
        <li id="cite_note-Rusch2013-379">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-Rusch2013_379-0">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation book">
           William G. Rusch (2013).
           <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=ZMgC0VsRee0C&amp;pg=PA31" rel="nofollow">
            <i>
             The Witness of Bartholomew I, Ecumenical Patriarch
            </i>
           </a>
           . Wm. B. Eerdmans Publishing. p. 31.
           <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">
            ISBN
           </a>
           <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8028-6717-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8028-6717-9">
            978-0-8028-6717-9
           </a>
           .
           <q>
            Constantinople has been the seat of an archiepiscopal see since the fourth century; its ruling hierarch has had the title of"Ecumenical Patriarch" ...
           </q>
          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Witness+of+Bartholomew+I%2C+Ecumenical+Patriarch&amp;rft.pages=31&amp;rft.pub=Wm.+B.+Eerdmans+Publishing&amp;rft.date=2013&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-8028-6717-9&amp;rft.au=William+G.+Rusch&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DZMgC0VsRee0C%26pg%3DPA31&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey">
           <span style="display:none;">
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </li>
        <li id="cite_note-FahlbuschBromiley2001-380">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-FahlbuschBromiley2001_380-0">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation book">
           Erwin Fahlbusch; Geoffrey William Bromiley (2001).
           <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=yaecVMhMWaEC&amp;pg=PA40" rel="nofollow">
            <i>
             The Encyclopedia of Christianity
            </i>
           </a>
           . Wm. B. Eerdmans Publishing. p. 40.
           <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">
            ISBN
           </a>
           <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-90-04-11695-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-90-04-11695-5">
            978-90-04-11695-5
           </a>
           .
           <q>
            The Ecumenical Patriarchate of Constantinople is the ranking church within the communion of ... Between the 4th and 15th centuries, the activities of the patriarchate took place within the context of an empire that not only was ...
           </q>
          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Encyclopedia+of+Christianity&amp;rft.pages=40&amp;rft.pub=Wm.+B.+Eerdmans+Publishing&amp;rft.date=2001&amp;rft.isbn=978-90-04-11695-5&amp;rft.au=Erwin+Fahlbusch&amp;rft.au=Geoffrey+William+Bromiley&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DyaecVMhMWaEC%26pg%3DPA40&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey">
           <span style="display:none;">
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </li>
        <li id="cite_note-381">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-381">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          The Oxford Dictionary of the Christian Church, s.v.
          <i>
           patriarch (ecclesiastical)
          </i>
          , also calls it "a title dating from the 6th century, for the bishops of the five great sees of Christendom". And
          <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=ZP_f9icf2roC&amp;printsec=frontcover#PPA845,M1" rel="nofollow">
           Merriam-Webster's Encyclopedia of World Religions
          </a>
          says: "Five patriarchates, collectively called the pentarchy, were the first to be recognized by the legislation of the emperor Justinian (reigned 527–565)".
         </span>
        </li>
        <li id="cite_note-382">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-382">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <a class="external text" href="http://www.britannica.com/eb/article-9059117/pentarchy" rel="nofollow">
           "Pentarchy"
          </a>
          .
          <i>
           <a href="/wiki/Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica" title="Encyclopædia Britannica">
            Encyclopædia Britannica
           </a>
          </i>
          . Retrieved February 14, 2010. "The proposed government of universal
          <a href="/wiki/Christendom" title="Christendom">
           Christendom
          </a>
          by five
          <a href="/wiki/Patriarch" title="Patriarch">
           patriarchal sees
          </a>
          under the auspices of a single universal empire. Formulated in the legislation of the emperor
          <a href="/wiki/Justinian_I" title="Justinian I">
           Justinian I
          </a>
          (527–65), especially in his Novella 131, the theory received formal ecclesiastical sanction at the
          <a href="/wiki/Quinisext_Council" title="Quinisext Council">
           Council in Trullo
          </a>
          (692), which ranked the five sees as Rome, Constantinople, Alexandria, Antioch, and Jerusalem".
         </span>
        </li>
        <li id="cite_note-383">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-383">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation journal">
           Içduygu, Ahmet; Toktas, Şule; Ali Soner, B. (1 February 2008).
           <a class="external text" href="https://www.academia.edu/761694/The_Politics_of_Population_in_a_Nation_Building_Process_Emigration_of_Non-Muslims_from_Turkey" rel="nofollow">
            "The politics of population in a nation-building process: emigration of non-Muslims from Turkey"
           </a>
           .
           <i>
            Ethnic and Racial Studies
           </i>
           .
           <b>
            31
           </b>
           (2): 358–389.
           <a href="/wiki/Digital_object_identifier" title="Digital object identifier">
            doi
           </a>
           :
           <a class="external text" href="//doi.org/10.1080%2F01419870701491937" rel="nofollow">
            10.1080/01419870701491937
           </a>
           .
          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Ethnic+and+Racial+Studies&amp;rft.atitle=The+politics+of+population+in+a+nation-building+process%3A+emigration+of+non-Muslims+from+Turkey&amp;rft.volume=31&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=358-389&amp;rft.date=2008-02-01&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1080%2F01419870701491937&amp;rft.aulast=I%C3%A7duygu&amp;rft.aufirst=Ahmet&amp;rft.au=Toktas%2C+%C5%9Eule%3B+Ali+Soner%2C+B.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.academia.edu%2F761694%2FThe_Politics_of_Population_in_a_Nation_Building_Process_Emigration_of_Non-Muslims_from_Turkey&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey">

            ^
           </a>

           </a>

           <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070218095819/http://www.turks.org.uk/index.php?pid=8" rel="nofollow">

           </a>
           . Royal Academy of Arts. Archived from
           <a class="external text" href="http://www.turks.org.uk/index.php?pid=8" rel="nofollow">

          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Turks+%E2%80%93+A+Journey+of+a+Thousand+Years%3A+600%E2%80%931600&amp;rft.pub=Royal+Academy+of+Arts&amp;rft.date=2005&amp;rft.au=Royal+Academy+of+Arts&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.turks.org.uk%2Findex.php%3Fpid%3D8&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey">
           <span style="display:none;">
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </li>
        <li id="cite_note-HarriOhta1999-418">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-HarriOhta1999_418-0">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation book">
           Antoinette Harri; Allison Ohta (1999).
           <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=1CxNAAAAYAAJ" rel="nofollow">
            <i>
             10th International Congress of Turkish Art
            </i>
           </a>
           . Fondation Max Van Berchem.
           <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">
            ISBN
           </a>
           <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-2-05-101763-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-2-05-101763-3">
            978-2-05-101763-3
           </a>
           .
           <q>
            The first military training institutions were the Imperial Army Engineering School (Mühendishane-i Berr-i Hümâyun, 1793) and the Imperial School of Military Sciences (Mekteb-i Ulûm-ı Harbiye-i Şahane, 1834). Both schools taught painting to enable cadets to produce topographic layouts and technical drawings to illustrate landscapes ...
           </q>
          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=10th+International+Congress+of+Turkish+Art&amp;rft.pub=Fondation+Max+Van+Berchem&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft.isbn=978-2-05-101763-3&amp;rft.au=Antoinette+Harri&amp;rft.au=Allison+Ohta&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D1CxNAAAAYAAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey">
           <span style="display:none;">
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </li>

            ^
           </a>

         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation web">
           <a class="external text" href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/apr/29/turkey-blocks-wikipedia-under-law-designed-to-protect-national-security" rel="nofollow">
            "Turkey blocks Wikipedia under law designed to protect national security"
           </a>
           . The Guardian. 29 April 2017
           <span class="reference-accessdate">
            . Retrieved
            <span class="nowrap">
             1 May
            </span>
            2017
           </span>
           .
          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Turkey+blocks+Wikipedia+under+law+designed+to+protect+national+security&amp;rft.pub=The+Guardian&amp;rft.date=2017-04-29&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Fworld%2F2017%2Fapr%2F29%2Fturkey-blocks-wikipedia-under-law-designed-to-protect-national-security&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey">
           <span style="display:none;">
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </li>
       </ol>
      </div>

                  <tr>
                   <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3" style="text-align:left;">
                    <div>
                     <div class="plainlist">
                      <ul>
                       <li>
                        <sup>
                         1
                        </sup>
                        <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">
                         Oceanic islands
                        </a>
                        within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.
                       </li>
                       <li>
                        <sup>
                         2
                        </sup>
                        Some countries completely outside the conventional geographical boundaries of Europe are commonly associated with the continent due to ethnological links.
                       </li>
                      </ul>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </td>

                    <div>
                     <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Asia_(orthographic_projection).svg">

                  <tr>
                   <th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">
                    People
                   </th>
                   <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                    <div style="padding:0em 0.25em">
                     <ul>
                      <li>
                       <a href="/wiki/Roberto_Azev%C3%AAdo" title="Roberto Azevêdo">
                        Roberto Azevêdo
                       </a>
                       (
                       <a href="/wiki/Director-General_of_the_World_Trade_Organization" title="Director-General of the World Trade Organization">
                        Director-General
                       </a>
                       )
                      </li>

                  <tr>
                   <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2">
                    <div>
                     <ol>
                      <li>
                       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Special_administrative_regions_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China" title="Special administrative regions of the People's Republic of China">
                        Special administrative regions of the People's Republic of China
                       </a>
                       , participates as "Hong Kong, China" and "Macao China".
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       Officially the Republic of China, participates as "
                       <a href="/wiki/Chinese_Taipei" title="Chinese Taipei">
                        Separate Customs Territory of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen and Matsu
                       </a>
                       ", and "Chinese Taipei" in short.
                      </li>
                     </ol>
                    </div>
                   </td>
